$eref.description: Defines the color of each raster cell based on the value of a numeric attribute. Colors are assigned based on classed ranges of data.
$eref.title: Raster ClassBreaks Renderer

___legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

___defaultLabel.description: Default label for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

___field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

___type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

___authoringInfo.description: An object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via the UI, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it.

___colorClassBreakInfos.description: Each element in the array is an object that provides information about a class break associated with the renderer.

___defaultColor.description: The defaultColor on the renderer that get assigned to features with no value or features that do not fall within the configured data.

___normalizationTotal.description: Used when normalizationType is percent-of-total, this number property contains the total of all data values.

___normalizationType.description: Determine how the data was normalized.

___normalizationField.description: Used when normalizationType is field. The string value indicating the attribute field by which the data value is normalized.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation:
For each `stretchType` there are specific sets of requirements that are as follows:
`none`: does not require other parameters.
`standardDeviation`: requires numberOfStandardDeviations, statistics, or dra.
`histogramEqualization`: requires the source dataset to have histograms or additional dra.
`minMax`: requires statistics or dra.
`percentClip`: requires minPercent, maxPercent, and dra.
`sigmoid`: does not require other parameters. Optionally, set the sigmoidStrengthLevel (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.

$eref.description: Displays continuous raster cell values across a gradual ramp of colors. Use this renderer to draw a single band of continuous data. This renderer works well when you have a large range of values to display, such as with imagery or scientific data.
$eref.title: Raster Stretch Renderer

___type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

___sigmoidStrengthLevel.description: Set this from (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.

___stretchType.description: The stretch types for stretch raster function.

___numberOfStandardDeviations.description: The number of standard deviations for standard deviation stretch.

___useGamma.description: Indicates if the renderer applies Gamma stretch.

___dra.description: Indicates if Dynamic Range Adjustment should be applied.

___computeGamma.description: Indicates if gamma values should be computed by default.

$eref.description: Defines the color of each raster cell based on an attribute. This is done by using unique colors to represent cells with equal attribute values.
$eref.title: Raster UniqueValue Renderer

___legendOptions.description: A legend containing one title, which is a string describing the renderer in the legend.

___defaultLabel.description: Default label for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

___field.description: The name of the field that is used for the renderer.

___type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

___authoringInfo.description: An object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via the UI, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it.

___defaultColor.description: The defaultColor on the renderer that get assigned to features with no value or features that do not fall within the configured data.
